title: Everything that happening this weekend on the North - West Coast | The Advocate
body_text:
ALL IN COMMUNITY ART EXHIBITION
Subscribe now for unlimited access.
or signup to continue reading
July 26 - September 13
The Devonport Regional Gallery invites you to its second annual community exhibition, All in.
The exhibition features artworks by creative locals of North-West Tasmania, representing all ages and all abilities.
It's a celebration of diversity, imagination, and the wonderful talent that exists within our region. Join us in celebrating you, our creative community.
The exhibition will be running in the Upper Gallery until September 13.
August 21-22
Mudlark Theatre is presenting a series of readings of extraordinary Australian plays.
Join our island's artists for a series of bespoke play readings featuring extraordinary theatre works by acclaimed Australian playwrights.
Road Works is the perfect winter theatre program, connecting audiences and artists across our island through relaxed and engaging evenings at the theatre, showcasing readings of powerhouse plays, and sparking rich conversations around creativity and the theatre-going experience.
The reading of Red Sky Morning by Tom Holloway will take place at the Burnie Arts Centre on August 21, and the paranaple Arts Centre on August 22.
Tickets/registration can be found here: https://www.mudlarktheatre.com.au/
ROTARY CLUB OF BURNIE COCKTAIL PARTY
August 22
With great food, a masquerade theme, music by Molly O'Brien, and great auction photos, this cocktail party is one not to be missed.
There will be guest appearances by Richmond Football Club legend and Tasmania Football Club CEO Brendon Gale, and coach of the Australian Women's Blind Cricket team Taylah Purton.
It will be held at Burnie Gentleman's Club from 7pm.
Tickets are $75 each, or a table of 10 is $700. They can be purchased by calling 0407 310 059.
THE UK ROD STEWART SHOW
August 22
Join us at the Burnie Arts Centre from 7.30pm for a memorable evening as we pay tribute to the songs of the one and only, Rod Stewart.
A legendary superstar of iconic proportions, Stewart's career spans a massive six decades. Rarely has a singer had as full and unique a talent as Rod Stewart.
The UK Rod Stewart Show brings to the stage a vocalist direct from the UK, just like the legend himself, and is the very epitome of the real deal - complete with powerful, raspy vocals and feathery, frosted mullet
Tonight's the Night! So, grab your Handbags and Gladrags, jump on a Downtown Train and answer the age-old question "Do Ya Think I'm Sexy?".
Tickets and more information can be found at burniearts.net/Whats-On/Performances/2025-Live/Rod-Stewart-Show.
WHEELCHAIR BASKETBALL ULVERSTONE
August 22 - November 14
Wheelchair basketball is an exciting version of basketball that offers a great way to keep fit, develop new skills and meet new friends.
ParaQuad Tasmania proudly delivers free wheelchair basketball programs throughout Tasmania.
The game was originally designed as a rehabilitation and recreation activity for those with a physical disability, in particularly those with a spinal cord injury but is now enjoyed by people of all abilities and ages.
For more information about the weekly event at Ulverstone Sports and Leisure Centre, email manager-programs@paraquadtas.org.au.
THE LIGHT NIGHT GLOW RUN
August 23
Get ready to light up the night at the Light Night Glow Run in Devonport.
The vibrant, family-friendly event transforms Devonport's Bluff Road into a glowing spectacle of fun, fitness, and community spirit.
Participants of all ages are encouraged to don their brightest, most colourful costumes and join in the festivities.
Whether you're running or walking, the atmosphere promises to be electric with glow sticks, music, and an abundance of energy
Choose from a variety of distances to suit all fitness levels: an 8km run, a 4km run, a 2km kids' run, and a 600m kids' dash.
Each event is designed to be inclusive and enjoyable for everyone, from seasoned runners to families looking for a fun night out.
Adding to the spirit of giving, $5 from every registration in the 4km and 8km events will be donated to a local charity chosen by the event's major sponsor.
More information can be found here: https://thelightnightglowrun.com/
CHOOSE YOUR OWN ADVENTURE
August 23
Queenie van de Zandt is coming to the Burnie Arts Centre to host an interactive cabaret where you decide how the night unfolds.
This ain't your grandma's dinner theatre, folks! In Choose Your Own Adventure, Queenie offers up a buffet of entertainment on a Lazy Susan. You want big, belty ballads? Consider it served. A pub quiz? You got it. A bit of stand-up comedy? Oh, honey, it's on the menu! But the best part? YOU get to choose what you want to see!
That's right, this daring diva is putting her fate in your hands. So, take a seat, whip out your smartphone and get ready to take control of how the night unfolds.
More information and tickets can be found at burniearts.net/Whats-On/Performances/2025-Live/Choose-you-own-Adventure.
PENGUIN FOOTBALL REUNION
August 23
From 11am to 11.30am at the Penguin Football Club rooms, a celebration of premierships between 1956 and 1975 will be held.
Open to members of those 20 teams from that era.
This will be a low-key, informal gathering; a wonderful opportunity to meet and reminisce with teammates.
This event has been organised by the Penguin History Group as part of the Penguin 150 celebration.
Cost of entry is $15, which includes finger food.
The clubroom is located at 1 Dial Park Drive, Penguin.
JUST A FARMER SCREENING
August 24
The Circular Head Community and Recreation Centre will be hosting a screening of the Australian film Just a Farmer.
The film is a compelling drama that authentically portrays the impact of suicide on a rural Australian family, shedding light on critical mental health issues in farming communities.
There will be a Q&A with actor, writer, producer, and executive producer Leila McDougall after the screening.
A free BBQ will be available from 5.30pm and the screening will begin at 6.30pm.
The film is rated M and not suitable for children.
Tickets can be found at justafarmertas.com.au.
MARCH FOR PALESTINE
August 24
Devonport is joining the nationwide March for Palestine.
Organisers said the aim was to condemn Israel's war crimes, stop the starvation of Palestinians, stop the genocide, stop weapons sales to Israel, and call for sanctions.
Attendees will meet at 11am at Waterfront Park before marching through the mall, down Stewart Street and along Formby Road.
DAFFODIL WORKSHOP
August 24
The Wynyard Garden Club is running a free workshop teaching people how to stage daffodils or steward for judges.
The free workshop, in preparation for the upcoming Spring Flower Shows, will be held at Uniting Church Hall at 9 Dodgin Street from 11.30am until 3pm.
Soup will be provided, and please bring a plate of food to share for afternoon tea.
For further information, contact 0438930660.
3D PRINTING CLUB FOR ADULTS
August 27
Learn how to create basic 3D designs using Tinkercad and how to import and adjust 3D designs to print using a 3D printer at Burnie Library.
Watch our 3D printer in action, printing demo builds as you create your design, ready for 3D printing.
As there will be multiple participants attending the session, there may not be time to print all designs during the session.
The 3D printer is available for viewing while printing during opening hours at its location near the front desk.
3D prints will be availble for colection after the session, you will be contacted when your design is ready to be collected from the front desk.
Burnie Library is located at 30 Alexander Street Burnie
AUTHOR EVENT - KONRAD MULLER
August 28
Konrad Muller will be at Burnie Library to discuss his new novel, My Heart at Evening, with Rodney Croome.
The piece of historical fiction, which investigates the suicide of Henry Hellyer, is an irresistible observation of the forces that shaped Tasmania, and Australia more broadly, from power, to mateship, sexuality, and isolation-forces we still recognise today.
It is the first volume by the publishing house Evercreech Editions, a new small press focused on publishing quality writing in Tasmania and beyond.
The event will run from 5.30pm until 7pm, and copies of the book will be available for purchase on the night.
For more information or to book, visit https://www.eventbrite.com.au/e/author-event-with-konrad-muller-at-burnie-library-tickets-1534498449169.
TASMANIAN ROCK CHALLENGE - NORTH-WEST HEAT
August 28
The Tasmanian Rock Challenge is a celebration of youth achievement in contemporary music.
The Tasmanian Rock Challenge presents a number of North-West bands for 2025 from a number of schools, including Smithton High School and Don College.
The event will be held at Forth Pub, located at 393 Leith Road, Forth, from 5pm.
SPRING CEILIDH
September 6
Join the Burnie Highland Pipe Band as they welcome Spring with lively music and some easy dances for all comers.
The Spring Ceilidh (it's like a bush dance with a Scottish accent) features music by Iain McLeod and a wee bit of piping.
All dances will be called, no experience necessary.
Adults $20, Full Time Students $10, children under 12 free (accompanied by an adult).
Please bring a plate to share for afternoon tea. BYO water bottle - dancing is thirsty work.
The event will be held at the Sulphur Creek Community Hall, at 310 Preservation Drive.
FERNGLADE - FOREST THERAPY WALK
September 7
A Forest Therapy walk gives you a unique perspective and includes activities to help you relax, such as deep breathing, stretching and sensory immersion.
Be inspired by science and poetry, and finish up with a delicious cup of herbal tea.
Activities will be tailored to bring health and harmony with the season.
The walk runs for two hours and is suitable for anyone with moderate fitness who can walk on inclines with loose surfaces.
Meet at 10am at the beginning of the 'Reserve Track' to Rutherford Road signage. From Massey-Green Drive, travel up Fern Glade Road, cross over the Emu River bridge and enter Fern Glade via the second entry on the right.
The track and small car park are located on the left-hand side before you get down to the main picnic area. Toilets are located at the main picnic area.
Bring clothing to be warm while standing, adequate footwear, drinking water and a raincoat to sit on.
Guide Elspeth Brock has worked for many years in horticulture and is a certified Forest Therapy Guide with the International Nature and Forest Therapy Alliance (INFTA).
CRADLE COAST ORCHESTRA GOES TO THE CINEMA
September 7
It is music that conveys the atmosphere, emotion and mood of a movie to its audience.
Come and join us to experience the transporting magic of the film score as you relive scenes from James Bond, Pirates of the Caribbean, Star Wars and more with the Cradle Coast Orchestra.
There is something for everyone, with many of your old favourites presented in a concert suitable for the whole family.
General tickets cost $15, concession $10 and children's $5 and can be purchased here: https://burnieartscouncil.com/cradle-coast-orchestra/
The event will be held at 2pm and 7pm at Parklands High School, 11 Atkins Drive, Romaine.
CYBER SECURITY INFO SESSION
September 10
Small to medium business owners across all industries are invited to join the Department of State Growth for a free cyber security information session where you will be given practical knowledge, tools, and resources to strengthen your cyber security defences.
The aim of the session is to raise awareness of the growing cyber risks faced by all Tasmanian businesses, highlight the importance of adopting proactive cyber risk management strategies, and introduce Federal government support programs such as those offered by IDCare and AusIndustry to help businesses respond to and recover from cyber incidents.
It will be held at The Point @ West Park Oval, 8 Bass Highway, Burnie, from 12pm. A light lunch will be provided.
For more information, email scott.smith@stategrowth.tas.gov.au or hazelyn.mohan@stategrowth.tas.gov.au.
NOWHERE ELSE ON EARTH FILM SCREENINGS
September 10-12
Dive deep into the blue with us at a screening of Nowhere Else on Earth, a captivating short film that showcases the extraordinary marine life of Tasmania.
Through stunning underwater footage and the voices of Tasmanians who share a deep connection to the sea, this film captures the wonder, beauty and fragility of one of the world's most unique and diverse marine environments.
Through the stories of an Olympic swimming legend, a fisher and ecotourism skipper, a marine science student, and a leading marine ecologist, Nowhere Else on Earth celebrates the power of the ocean to inspire, sustain, and connect us all.
Stay after the screening for a Q&A session with special guests, where we'll discuss how we can all play a role in safeguarding Tassie's marine environment.
Screenings will be held from 6pm at Port Sorell (September 10), Stanley (September 11), and Penguin (September 12).
For tickets and more information, visit https://events.humanitix.com/host/environment-tasmania
ECHOES OF PINK FLOYD
September 11
This year marks the diamond anniversary of Pink Floyd's inception, and to honour this milestone, every era of Pink Floyd's illustrious career will be celebrated in grand style at Burnie Arts Centre.
Echoes of Pink Floyd will take audiences on a mesmerising journey through six decades of Pink Floyd's unparalleled musical legacy. From the psychedelic sounds of the 1960s to the progressive rock masterpieces and stadium-shaking anthems of their latter years, this show will capture the true essence of Pink Floyd's evolution with precision and passion.
The evening will kick off at 8pm and tickets can be found at burniearts.net/Whats-On/2025/Pink-Floyd.
ONCE UPON A TIME
September 11-20
Burnie High School is very excited to be staging the Tasmanian premiere of the spectacular musical production Once Upon a Time.
This is a very original show, loosely based on the fairy stories written by the Brothers Grimm.
The plot features characters from Rapunzel, Rumpelstiltskin, Hansel and Gretel, Snow White and the Seven Dwarves, Cinderella and the Brave Little Tailor.
Three witches, together with Rumpelstiltskin, plan to remove all of the princes from Fairyland so that there will be no one to stop them in their bid to rule the kingdom. They are foiled, however, by Dame Rosy Parker and her friends, who thwart their evil plan.
Featuring a cast, band and crew of more than 160 students, this musical features lots of corny gags and represents excellent entertainment for audiences of all ages.
One of the most appealing features of this production is the eclectic musical score that includes songs from artists such as ABBA, Lady Gaga, Michael Jackson and The Proclaimers.
Held at Burnie High School, 77-79 Wilmot Street, Burnie.
Tickets can be found here: https://www.burniearts.net/Whats-On/2025/BHS-Once-Upon-a-Time.
SUICIDE AWARENESS/PREVENTION WALK
September 12
A walk will be held at Burnie Park to help bring suicide out of the shadows.
Participants in the Suicide Awareness/Prevention Walk are asked to meet at the park at 5.30pm, with the walk starting at 7pm.
Ticket cost is $4 and can be purchased here: https://cradletickets.com/current-events/out-of-the-shadows-suicide-awareness-walk-in-burnie-september-12/
DAFFODIL AND FLOWER FAIR
September 13
Come and smell the daffodils with the Central Coast Garden Club for their flower fair.
Heald at the Ulverstone Rowing Club at Kings Parade, Ulverstone from 8.30am to 3.30am.
Daffodil and flower entries on Friday from 10am to 12pm, with judging on Friday afternoon.
Entry for adults is $3.
LATROBE FESTIVAL OF ARTS
September 18-20
An initiative of the Interact Club of Latrobe High School, the festival will take place at various locations across Latrobe.
It aims to promote and celebrate the performing and visual arts talent in the Latrobe Municipality while fostering community engagement with the arts.
The weekend will include static displays of visual arts, a fashion parade, and performance showcases, among other events.
For more information, visit Latrobe Festival of Arts' Facebook page.
BETTER MAN
September 26
The Australian tour starring the world's only officially endorsed Robbie Williams tribute, Mike Andrew, is coming to Devonport.
With an uncanny resemblance to Robbie - right down to the mannerisms, swagger, and matching tattoos - Mike doesn't just perform the hits, he becomes Robbie
From iconic anthems like Angels and Millennium to crowd favourites Let Me Entertain You and Better Man, this is a full-throttle celebration of Robbie's legendary catalogue.
Tickets for the 8pm show start at $49.90 and can be purchased from paranapleartscentre.com.au.
AUSTRALIAN ARMY BAND TASMANIA
September 26
Presented by The Jazz Club, experience the magic of the Australian Army Band Tasmania's (AAB-T) Jazz Ensemble, who have been a beloved part of the Tasmanian community, performing at major events and supporting charitable causes for over 100 years.
This talented group of enlisted personnel brings a fresh and exciting take on jazz from bebop to bossa nova, with unique interpretations of popular tunes.
Whether you're a jazz aficionado or simply looking for a night of great music, the AAB-T Jazz Ensemble will deliver an unforgettable performance, blending smooth rhythms, creative improvisation, and that special spark only live jazz can offer.
For more information and tickets, visit burniearts.net/Whats-On/Performances/2025-Live/Jazz-Club-Australian-Army-Band-Tasmania.
